alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 2:52AM EDT until March 29 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Griffin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will be flooded with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early this morning to 16 feet this evening. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 13.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
